attributes.action: Address concerns of the LGBT+ Community over the Gender Recognition Act Reforms.
attributes.additional_details: There are serious concerns within the LGBT community about the level the proposed reforms, or lack thereof, will infringe upon the rights and freedoms of members of the Transgender Community. As an already marginalised community the proposals the minister has put forward further marginalise and endanger Transgender people in public spaces. The removal of proposed reforms for the Gender Recognition Process will also reinforce a traumatic system that a vulnerable community has to go through.
attributes.background: Hold Elisabeth Truss to account for her proposals for reform of the Gender Recognition Act (2004), concerns are related to the proposals to enforce "Single Sex Safe Spaces" in public space, and to drop the proposal to reform the Gender Recognition Process.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318175

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318025

Add gender identity to the characteristics protected under the Equality Act 2010:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301138

Require schools and colleges to have gender neutral toilets:

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts:
